hints_html: The trick is to multiply enumerator and denominator by the complex conjugate \(\overline{z}\) of the denominator. That way you just divide by a real number, which is easy to handle.
hints_latex:
The trick is to multiply enumerator and denominator by the complex
conjugate $\overline{z}$ of the denominator. That way you just divide by
a real number, which is easy to handle.
hints_raw: The trick is to multiply enumerator and denominator by the complex conjugate <math>\overline{z}</math> of the denominator. That way you just divide by a real number, which is easy to handle.
question: A 24
sols_html:
Using the hint and the facts \(\overline{z} = 1+i\) and i2 = -1 we compute

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{u}{z} &= \frac{3+2i}{1-i} \\ &= \frac{(3+2i)(1+i)}{(1-i)(1+i)} \\ &= \frac{3+3i+2i+2i^2}{1-i^2} \\ &= \frac{1+5i}{2} \\ &= \frac12 + \frac52 i\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
Using the hint and the facts $\overline{z} = 1+i$ and
\emph{i}\textsuperscript{2} = \emph{-1} we compute

\begin{align*}
\frac{u}{z} &= \frac{3+2i}{1-i} \\
&= \frac{(3+2i)(1+i)}{(1-i)(1+i)} \\
&= \frac{3+3i+2i+2i^2}{1-i^2} \\
&= \frac{1+5i}{2} \\
&= \frac12 + \frac52 i
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
Using the hint and the facts <math>\overline{z} = 1+i</math> and ''i''<sup>2</sup> = ''-1'' we compute

:<math> \begin{align}
\frac{u}{z} &= \frac{3+2i}{1-i} \\
&= \frac{(3+2i)(1+i)}{(1-i)(1+i)} \\
&= \frac{3+3i+2i+2i^2}{1-i^2} \\
&= \frac{1+5i}{2} \\
&= \frac12 + \frac52 i
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
For questions A22 - A24 below, \(u\), \(z\) are complex numbers given below:

\[\begin{aligned} u = 3 + 2i, \quad z = 1 - i\end{aligned}\]

A24: Evaluate \(u/z\). Put your answer in the form \(a + ib\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are real numbers.
statement_raw:
For questions <b>A22 - A24</b> below, <math>u</math>, <math>z</math> are complex numbers given below:

:<math>
u = 3 + 2i, \quad z = 1 - i
</math>

<b>A24</b>: Evaluate <math>u/z</math>. Put your answer in the form <math>a + ib</math> where <math>a</math> and <math>b</math> are real numbers.
